title: Automated Software Verification of Hyperliveness
abstract:
Abstract
Hyperproperties relate multiple executions of a program and are commonly used to specify security and information-flow policies.
Most existing work has focused on the verification of kùëòk-safety properties, i.e., properties that state that all kùëòk-tuples of execution traces satisfy a given property.
In this paper, we study the automated verification of richer properties that combine universal and existential quantification over executions.
Concretely, we consider ‚àÄk‚àÉlsuperscriptfor-allùëòsuperscriptùëô\forall^{k}\exists^{l} properties, which state that for all kùëòk executions, there exist lùëôl executions that, together, satisfy a property.
This captures important non-kùëòk-safety requirements, including hyperliveness properties such as generalized non-interference, opacity, refinement, and robustness.
We design an automated constraint-based algorithm for the verification of ‚àÄk‚àÉlsuperscriptfor-allùëòsuperscriptùëô\forall^{k}\exists^{l} properties.
Our algorithm leverages a sound-and-complete program logic and a (parameterized) strongest postcondition computation.
We implement our algorithm in a tool called ForEx and report on encouraging experimental results.
